page.title: 19Historical Interest
page.content: {The Fish Cellars- Port Isaac } Port Isaac was very famous for its kippers throughout the country.You can still see the smokehouse where they used to smoke them.You can also still see the holes in the walls where they used to slot in planks of wood either side of the room.This was part of the balking process.The fishing trade has decreased over the years but,there are still more lobsters caught in Port Isaac than anywhere else in the country. {Squeeze Belly Alley Port Isaac This alley is the narrowest thoroughfare in the world. You can find it in Dolphin Street. It is 55 cms wide and 1m 94 cms high. {Post Office_ Port Isaac} The Post Office in Fore Street was the old lifeboat house.It is now housed in the cellars near the beach.
